item.title: Huge amount of rubbish, 16th October
item.description:
There is rubbish scattered all over the side of the street and human faeces further down the road. After bad weather blows it in to the road and it is hard to pass in my car.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Frederick Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken tree ties, 16th October
item.description:
The hessian ties on the newly planted tree outside 52/54 Goodhart Way have become detached/broken from the wooden support poles so now the tree is leaning in towards the pavement. Can you please arrange to have new ties fitted asap as we cannot see a way that we can do this. Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, Goodhart Way, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadwork sign missed, 16th October
item.description:
East street was turned into a 2 way road last week due to emergency water repairs, this sign has been missed when all the other signs where removed once the roadworks had finished.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Street, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste outside 179 Alnwick Road. Health hazard., 16th October
item.description:
Large amount of poo on pavement. Please clean up as it cannot wait until next week’s street cleaning. Health hazard to children during pick up times from school across road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alnwick Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti tags sprayed on red brick wall to the right side of a bus stop leading to estates., 16th October
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed on a redbrick wall situated to the right side of a bus stop. The wall leads to residential estates. The location is opposite the road from Sharpes Barbershop 306 Brixton road SW9. The graffiti tags have been there for over two months. Please can the graffiti tags be painted over. There is more graffiti sprayed by a entrance door further up but you might need a resident to allow you access.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 316, Brixton Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poops along Walden road getting worse, 16th October
item.description:
On the pathway from the corner of downs avenue heading up Walden road towards warratah drive there are several smudges and puddles and smears of dog poops on pavements. It’s getting worse daily and warratah drive on the grass entrance seems to be a dumping ground for people’s poo bags. I suppose we should be grateful they manage to bag up poop but I can’t understand why it’s so difficult to take it home to put in a bin.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walden Road, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: After bin collection rubbish all down road, 16th October
item.description:
Hello, How can we avoid litter in the roads from the recycling bags? Where all the recycling bags are pooled together it leaves a bunch of litter where the bags split. In Islington we had boxes and bins for recycling - no litter.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
